name: places/ChIJy09S35z2wokRVe4adkzvLGY
formattedAddress: 511 W 165th St, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 511 W 165th St, New York, NY 10032, USA

originalText.text:
sad but true.  i love my little post office on W 158th.  i never look forward to this one.  there are systemic failures here.  the manager needs to go and start fresh.  recently they lost package (as they have done in the past with other packages).  sent email they had it.  i went to retrieve, was there for an hour while they couldn't find it.  asked to speak with manager.  waited half hour only to be then told he was on the phone and couldn't come out.
was told they would call me about package. never did.  the whole time i watched one of the employees sit at his window and hold people in line while he was texting away on his phone...multiple times...between every waiting customer!  but i did NOT find the employee i dealt with rude at all.  she was lovely and tried to help.  and the woman running the passports was very helpful.  i had plenty of time to observe!

originalText.text: I went here to overnight a deed for my mother who is on hospice and most likely will not make it for longer than 36 to 48 hours. I was told the overnight shipping does not exist and it would get there Saturday (it is Tuesday). I said I need my document back and she told me to “stop playing games”. My moms death is not a game. You all should be so ashamed of your customer service.

originalText.text: Two weeks waiting for my passport appointment only to find out when i arrived that the person in charge of passports was not there and nobody knew if she would even work that day. Someone came up to the window and his only advice was to “make another appointment”..

text.text: Two weeks waiting for my passport appointment only to find out when i arrived that the person in charge of passports was not there and nobody knew if she would even work that day. Someone came up to the window and his only advice was to “make another appointment”..

originalText.text: This post office does not have walk in passport hours, the website is incorrect. The employees were very dismissive and rude.

text.text: This post office does not have walk in passport hours, the website is incorrect. The employees were very dismissive and rude.

originalText.text: Since moving to New York City, I have not had a worse experience in a USPS office than at this location. The service was quite slow and the whole vibe in the place was general unhappiness from both the staff and the customers. If I can avoid it, I won't be returning to this location. I'm giving 2-stars for this office's proximity to NewYork-Presbyterian/Columbia University Irving Medical Center.
